required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Darbepoetin Alfa and Anemia of Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Open-label, Comparative Study to Estimate the Effect of Darbepoetin Alfa on Hospital Days, Economic Outcomes, and Health-related Quality of Life in Subjects With Nonmyeloid Malignancies and Anemia of Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This phase 2, multicenter, randomized, open-label, comparative study was designed to determine the effect of darbepoetin alfa on hospital days, economic outcomes, and health related quality of life (HRQOL) in anemic patients with nonmyeloid malignancies who were not receiving chemotherapy. Participants were randomly assigned in a 4:1 allocation ratio to receive either 21 weeks of darbepoetin alfa treatment (treatment group) or 12 weeks of observation followed by up to 9 weeks of darbepoetin alfa treatment (observation group).

clinical_study.why_stopped: slow enrollment and change in product development strategy

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Hospitalized During the Test Period
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants hospitalized during Weeks 1-12 as self-reported in the Health Care Utilization portion of the Subject Outcome Questionaire.

primary_outcome.measure: Days of Hospitalization During the Test Period
primary_outcome.description: Number of days hospitalized during Weeks 1-12 as self-reported in the Health Care Utilization portion of the Subject Outcome Questionaire; participants who were not hospitalized had a value of 0 days.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Hospitalizations During the Test Period
primary_outcome.description: Number of times participants were hospitalized as self-reported in the Health Care Utilization portion of the Subject Outcome Questionaire during Weeks 1-12

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Hospital Costs During the Test Period
secondary_outcome.description: The hospital bill database was used to determine the mean total hospital cost per participant during the test period. Participants who were not hospitalized had a cost of $0 imputed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy (FACT)-Fatigue Score at Week 13
secondary_outcome.description: The FACT-Fatigue scale comprises 13 questions evaluating the impact of anemia on cancer patients with various tumor types receiving chemotherapy. Fatigue scores range from 0 to 52, with a higher score indicating less fatigue.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hemoglobin Response During the Test Period
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants achieving a hemoglobin response, defined as an increase in hemoglobin from baseline of ≥ 2.0 g/dL in the absence of red blood cell (RBC) transfusions during the preceding 28 days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hematopoietic Response During the Test Period
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants achieving a hematopoietic response, defined as an increase in hemoglobin from baseline of ≥ 2.0 g/dL or a concentration ≥ 12.0 g/dL both in the absence of red blood cell (RBC) transfusions during the preceding 28 days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin Level
secondary_outcome.description: The difference between hemoglobin concentrations after 12 weeks of treatment and the Baseline hemoglobin concentration value (Study Day 1 sample prior to first dose of darbepoetin alfa).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Red Blood Cell (RBC) Transfusions During the Test Period
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with at least one RBC transfusion during Weeks 1 to 12.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Units of Red Blood Cells Transfused During the Test Period
secondary_outcome.description: The average number of standard units of red blood cells transfused during Weeks 1 to 12.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Days of Red Blood Cell Transfusions During the Test Period
secondary_outcome.description: The number of days when at least one red blood cell transfusion was administered during Weeks 1 to 12.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Red Blood Cell (RBC) Transfusions During Weeks 5-12
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants with at least one RBC transfusion during weeks 5 to 12.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Units of Red Blood Cells Transfused During Weeks 5-12
secondary_outcome.description: The number of standard units of RBCs transfused during Weeks 5 to 12.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Days of Red Blood Cell Transfusions During Weeks 5-12
secondary_outcome.description: The number of days when at least one RBC transfusion was administered during Weeks 5 to 12.

arm_group.description: Participants in the observation group were evaluated once every 2 weeks for the first 12 weeks (test period). No darbepoetin alfa was administered to the observation group during this period. Darbepoetin alfa could be initiated at a dose of 3.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks beginning with the first visit after the test period at which the participants hemoglobin concentration was less than or equal to 11.0 g/dL. The dose of darbepoetin alfa could be increased to 5.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks after 6 weeks of darbepoetin alfa treatment in participants with a hemoglobin change from baseline of less than 1.0 g/dL.

Participants in the treatment group received darbepoetin alfa subcutaneously (SC) at a dose of 3.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks for 21 weeks. The dose of darbepoetin alfa could be increased at week 7 (to 5.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks) or at week 13 (to 9.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks) in participants with a hemoglobin change from baseline of less than 1.0 g/dL who dose escalated at week 7.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- nonmyeloid malignancies (including lymphocytic leukemias)
- anemia (hemoglobin concentration less than or equal to 11.0 g/dL) due to cancer and/or previous chemotherapy or radiotherapy
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status of 0 to 2
- adequate liver and renal functions
- 18 years or older
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of recombinant human erythropoietin therapy, cytotoxic chemotherapy, or more than 30 Gy radiotherapy to the whole pelvis within 4 weeks before screening
- acute myelogenous leukemia, chronic myelogenous leukemia, or myelodysplastic syndrome
- known hematologic disorders that could cause anemia
- inflammatory or cardiac disorders
- previous positive antibody response to any erythropoietic agent
- history of pure red cell aplasia

results_reference.citation: Charu V, Belani CP, Gill AN, Bhatt M, Tomita D, Rossi G, Ben-Jacob A. Efficacy and safety of every-2-week darbepoetin alfa in patients with anemia of cancer: a controlled, randomized, open-label phase II trial. Oncologist. 2007 Jun;12(6):727-37.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: First Patient Randomized: 24-Jun-2002 Last Patient Randomized: 08-Aug-2003

group.title: Darbepoetin Alfa 3 μg/kg
group.description: Participants in the treatment group received darbepoetin alfa subcutaneously (SC) at a dose of 3.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks for 21 weeks. The dose of darbepoetin alfa could be increased at Week 7 (to 5.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks) or at Week 13 (to 9.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks) in participants with a hemoglobin change from baseline of less than 1.0 g/dL who dose escalated at Week 7.

group.title: Observation
group.description: Participants in the observation group were evaluated once every 2 weeks for the first 12 weeks (test period). No darbepoetin alfa was administered during this period. Darbepoetin alfa could be initiated at a dose of 3.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks beginning with the first visit after the test period at which the participant's hemoglobin concentration was less than or equal to 11.0 g/dL. The dose of darbepoetin alfa could be increased to 5.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks after 6 weeks of darbepoetin alfa treatment in participants with a hemoglobin change from baseline of less than 1.0 g/dL.

group.description: Participants in the observation group were evaluated once every 2 weeks for the first 12 weeks (test period). No darbepoetin alfa was administered during this period. group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Demographic data are provided for the Efficacy Analysis Set (all patients who were randomized to the observation group or patients who were randomized to the treatment group and received at least 1 dose of investigational product).

outcome.title: Number of Participants Hospitalized During the Test Period
outcome.description: Number of participants hospitalized during Weeks 1-12 as self-reported in the Health Care Utilization portion of the Subject Outcome Questionaire.
outcome.population: Includes all randomized patients in the darbepoetin alfa arm who received at least 1 dose of study drug or all randomized patients in the observation arm. Patients also needed to have completed the baseline and at least 1 post-baseline subject outcome questionaire.

group.title: Darbepoetin Alfa 3 μg/kg
group.description: Participants in the treatment group received darbepoetin alfa subcutaneously (SC) at a dose of 3.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks for 21 weeks. measure.title: Number of Participants Hospitalized During the Test Period
measure.description: Number of participants hospitalized during Weeks 1-12 as self-reported in the Health Care Utilization portion of the Subject Outcome Questionaire.
measure.population: Includes all randomized patients in the darbepoetin alfa arm who received at least 1 dose of study drug or all randomized patients in the observation arm. Patients also needed to have completed the baseline and at least 1 post-baseline subject outcome questionaire.

outcome.title: Total Hospital Costs During the Test Period
outcome.description: The hospital bill database was used to determine the mean total hospital cost per participant during the test period. Participants who were not hospitalized had a cost of $0 imputed.
outcome.population: Includes all randomized patients in the darbepoetin alfa arm who received at least 1 dose of study drug or all randomized patients in the observation arm, and were included in the hospital bill database. Participants who were not hospitalized had a cost of $0 imputed.

group.title: Darbepoetin Alfa 3 μg/kg

measure.title: Total Hospital Costs During the Test Period
measure.description: The hospital bill database was used to determine the mean total hospital cost per participant during the test period. Participants who were not hospitalized had a cost of $0 imputed.
measure.population: Includes all randomized patients in the darbepoetin alfa arm who received at least 1 dose of study drug or all randomized patients in the observation arm, and were included in the hospital bill database. Participants who were not hospitalized had a cost of $0 imputed.

outcome.title: Change in Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy (FACT)-Fatigue Score at Week 13
outcome.description: The FACT-Fatigue scale comprises 13 questions evaluating the impact of anemia on cancer patients with various tumor types receiving chemotherapy. Fatigue scores range from 0 to 52, with a higher score indicating less fatigue.
outcome.population: Includes all randomized patients in the darbepoetin alfa arm who received at least 1 dose of study drug or all randomized patients in the observation arm. Participants also needed to have completed the baseline and at least 1 post-baseline FACT-Fatigue questionaire. Last Value Carried Forward (LVCF) imputation used.

group.title: Darbepoetin Alfa 3 μg/kg
group.description: Participants in the treatment group received darbepoetin alfa subcutaneously (SC) at a dose of 3.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks for 21 weeks. The dose of darbepoetin alfa could be increased at Week 7 (to 5.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks) or at Week 13 (to 9.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks) in participants with a hemoglobin change from baseline of less than 1.0 g/dL who dose escalated at Week 7.

The dose of darbepoetin alfa could be increased to 5.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks after 6 weeks of darbepoetin alfa treatment in participants with a hemoglobin change from baseline of less than 1.0 g/dL.

measure.title: Change in Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy (FACT)-Fatigue Score at Week 13
measure.description: The FACT-Fatigue scale comprises 13 questions evaluating the impact of anemia on cancer patients with various tumor types receiving chemotherapy. Fatigue scores range from 0 to 52, with a higher score indicating less fatigue.
measure.population: Includes all randomized patients in the darbepoetin alfa arm who received at least 1 dose of study drug or all randomized patients in the observation arm. Participants also needed to have completed the baseline and at least 1 post-baseline FACT-Fatigue questionaire. Last Value Carried Forward (LVCF) imputation used.

outcome.description: The number of participants achieving a hemoglobin response, defined as an increase in hemoglobin from baseline of ≥ 2.0 g/dL in the absence of red blood cell (RBC) transfusions during the preceding 28 days.
outcome.population: Includes all randomized patients in the darbepoetin alfa arm who received at least 1 dose of study drug or all randomized patients in the observation arm. Patients also needed to have a baseline hemoglobin that was not affected by a red blood cell transfusion.

outcome.population: Includes all randomized patients in the darbepoetin alfa arm who received at least 1 dose of study drug or all randomized patients in the observation arm, and who were on-study as of the beginning of Week 5 (Study Day 29).

group.title: Darbepoetin Alfa 3 μg/kg
group.description: Participants in the treatment group received darbepoetin alfa subcutaneously (SC) at a dose of 3.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks for 21 weeks. The dose of darbepoetin alfa could be increased at Week 7 (to 5.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks) or at Week 13 (to 9.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks) in participants with a hemoglobin change from baseline of less than 1.0 g/dL who dose escalated at Week 7.

group.title: Observation
group.description: Participants in the observation group were evaluated once every 2 weeks for the first 12 weeks (test period). No darbepoetin alfa was administered during this period. Darbepoetin alfa could be initiated at a dose of 3.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks beginning with the first visit after the test period at which the participant's hemoglobin concentration was less than or equal to 11.0 g/dL. The dose of darbepoetin alfa could be increased to 5.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks after 6 weeks of darbepoetin alfa treatment in participants with a hemoglobin change from baseline of less than 1.0 g/dL.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Red Blood Cell (RBC) Transfusions During Weeks 5-12
measure.description: The number of participants with at least one RBC transfusion during weeks 5 to 12.
measure.population: Includes all randomized patients in the darbepoetin alfa arm who received at least 1 dose of study drug or all randomized patients in the observation arm, and who were on-study as of the beginning of Week 5 (Study Day 29).

reported_events.time_frame: First dose through End of Study or 30 days after last dose, up to 25 weeks.
reported_events.desc: The table of Other Adverse Events summarizes the most frequent non-serious occurrences of adverse events.

group.title: Treatment Arm
group.description: Participants in the treatment group received darbepoetin alfa subcutaneously (SC) at a dose of 3.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks for 21 weeks. The dose of darbepoetin alfa could be increased at week 7 (to 5.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks) or at week 13 (to 9.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks) in participants with a hemoglobin change from baseline of less than 1.0 g/dL who dose escalated at week 7.

group.title: Observation Arm Treated
group.description: Participants in the observation group who received darbepoetin alfa, initiated at a dose of 3.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks beginning with the first visit after the test period at which the participants hemoglobin concentration was less than or equal to 11.0 g/dL. The dose of darbepoetin alfa could be increased to 5.0 μg/kg once every 2 weeks after 6 weeks of darbepoetin alfa treatment in participants with a hemoglobin change from baseline of less than 1.0 g/dL. Adverse events for participants in this group could have been reported at any time during the study; and therefore, may have occurred before darbepoetin alfa administration.

group.title: Observation Arm Not Treated
group.description: Participants in the observation group who did not receive any darbepoetin alfa treatment.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Small cell lung cancer stage unspecified

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Clinical Trial Agreement generally does not restrict an investigator's discussion of trial results after completion. The Agreement permits Amgen a limited period of time to review material discussing trial results (typically up to 45 days and possible extension). Amgen may remove confidential information, but authors have final control and approval of publication content. For multi-center studies, the investigator agrees not to publish any results before the first multi-center publication.
